content.match_overview: This London derby pits 10th-placed Fulham against 13th-placed Tottenham at Craven Cottage, with both sides separated by just three points in the Premier League table. Fulham arrive following a disappointing 2-1 loss to Brighton despite taking an early lead, while Tottenham come off an impressive 3-1 Europa League victory over AZ Alkmaar. Historically, Spurs have dominated this fixture with four wins in their last five visits before Fulham's shock 3-0 victory here last March. Marco Silva's side have shown defensive vulnerabilities at home, conceding more goals at Craven Cottage than on their travels, while Ange Postecoglou's men boast the league's second-best attack with 55 goals scored [1][3][4]. Both teams enter this clash needing points for European qualification aspirations, setting up a tactical battle between Fulham's organized defense and Tottenham's free-flowing attack.

citations.description: Match preview with team form and head-to-head analysis
Fulham's xG statistics and defensive metrics
Betting market analysis and statistical probabilities
Recent form analysis and historical matchup data

team_news.raw: Fulham face midfield disruptions with Sasa Lukic suspended and Adama Traoré doubtful. Tottenham regain Sergio Reguilón and Timo Werner from injury but remain without key attackers Richarlison and Dejan Kulusevski [3].

home.projected_xi: Bernd Leno; Issa Diop, Joachim Andersen, Calvin Bassey; Antonee Robinson, Andreas Pereira, Sander Berge, Timothy Castagne; Alex Iwobi, Emile Smith Rowe; Raul Jimenez

away.projected_xi: Guglielmo Vicario; Djed Spence, Cristian Romero, Micky van de Ven, Pedro Porro; Rodrigo Bentancur, Lucas Bergvall, Pape Sarr; Son Heung-Min, Brennan Johnson, Dominic Solanke

asian_handicap_analysis.analysis: The -0.5 line presents value on Tottenham given their superior xG (1.64 vs 1.51) and Fulham's home defensive record (1.21 xGA vs league average 1.15). Spurs have covered this handicap in 4 of their last 5 away games against mid-table opponents [4][6]. However, fatigue from European competition reduces confidence in a full handicap cover.
asian_handicap_analysis.raw: Fulham's home xGA of 1.21 exceeds league average despite playing 2 fewer home games than Spurs' away matches. Tottenham's last 5 away games average 2.4 goals scored compared to Fulham's 1.8 conceded at Craven Cottage [2][6].

key_player_matchups.title: Raúl Jiménez vs Cristian Romero
key_player_matchups.content: Jiménez has scored 7 of his 10 goals at home, but faces Romero who's won 68% of aerial duels this season. The Mexican's movement against Spurs' high line could prove decisive [1][3].
key_player_matchups.raw: Jiménez averages 0.48 xG/90 at home vs Romero's 1.2 tackles/90 in away matches [2][5].

key_player_matchups.title: Son Heung-Min vs Calvin Bassey
key_player_matchups.content: Son's 12 goal contributions in 2025 test Bassey's 1.5 interceptions/game. The Nigerian's recovery speed vs Son's diagonal runs creates a crucial flank battle [3][5].
key_player_matchups.raw: Son converts 29% of chances created down right flank - Bassey's side of defense [6].

betting_insights.insight: Tottenham's 58.8% implied probability (1.70 odds) exceeds market valuations given Fulham's home defensive frailties [7]
betting_insights.raw: Spurs have won 3 of last 4 away London derbies vs mid-table opponents [5]

betting_insights.insight: 19 of Tottenham's 28 league games (68%) cleared 2.5 goals vs Fulham's 60% home over rate [1][4]
betting_insights.raw: Combined xG total of 3.15 from both teams' last 5 matches [2][6]

betting_insights.insight: Raúl Jiménez scores 70% of his goals at home, facing Spurs' defense missing Dragusin [1][3]
betting_insights.raw: Jiménez averages 0.48 xG/90 at Craven Cottage this season [2]

prediction.reasoning: Tottenham's superior firepower (55 goals vs Fulham's 38) should overcome home advantage. Spurs have scored 2+ in 4 of last 5 away games, while Fulham's midfield absences disrupt their transition game [1][4][5].

my_say.content: Under the shadow of the Thames, Craven Cottage hosts a clash of contrasting philosophies - Silva's structured pragmatism versus Postecoglou's chaotic brilliance. All eyes on Son Heung-Min, seeking to add another London scalp to his collection, while Jiménez aims to continue his cottage-core scoring romance. With Tottenham's attack finally at full throttle and Fulham's defense missing its midfield shield, this derby could hinge on which version of Spurs shows up - the Europa League conquerors or the league's Jekyll-and-Hyde act. One stat looms large: 19 of Spurs' games have seen 3+ goals. Buckle up for fireworks by the riverside.
